name: fibre production, flax, scutching | fibre, flax, long, scutched | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29456/documentation

The data represent the scutching process for EUROPEAN FLAX™ fibre: western Europe - France, Belgium or Netherlands – amount for 3/4 of world production of flax fibre. EUROPEAN FLAX™ is a certification of origin and traceability owned by the Alliance for European Flax-Linen and Hemp (formerly known as CELC) which covers 100% of the fibres obtained from western European scutching, and guarantees third party verified traceability downstream. Scutching is an entirely mechanical process performed on flax straw, dew-retted, To extract the fibres and separate them from the woody stalk of the plant (shives). European Flax™ average yield in weight is 22% fibre, flax, long, scutched and 11% fibre, flax, short, scutched, those yields are entirely specific to western Europe and not reproducible in other geographies. Beyond fibres, the entire plant is used and nothing is wasted. Long and short fibres are used for textiles and technical textiles; shives for mulch, bedding, panel board, combustion; seeds for oil; even the soil and dust are used for potting soil. In this dataset, for this 1st version, only long and short fibres have been taken into account in the allocation, other co-products will be accounted for in a future iteration (long and short fibres together represent 94% of value of the whole products and co-products of scutching). Next processing steps: fibre, flax, long, scutched will undergo hackling to produce Hackled long fibre sliver and Hackle short fibre; while fibre, flax, short, scutched will be re-scutched to be used either for cottonizing or for carding and combing (for more information see the Mapping published by the Alliance in https://allianceflaxlinenhemp.eu/en/european-flax-linen-hemp-media-library). Scutching is performed all year round, either during the year after harvest or later as it can be stored a long time without losing its quality. Packaging for long fibres is usually flax rope, it has not been taken into account as considered neglectable. Packaging for fibre, flax, short, scutched is iron wire, hence an average 5 g/kg scutching short fibre has been included. Transport within the mill is included (straw from storage to scutching line and fibres to storage). Transport from field to scutching is not included.

This activity begins from feeding the flax straw, dew-retted into scutching line 

The activity ends with the baling of fibre (long and short). Transport from filed to scutching is excluded.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The data refer to 5 years of scutching production from 2014 until and including 2018.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data represent a weighted average across the 3 European countries producing flax: France, Belgium and the Netherlands. This production is 100% certified to EUROPEAN FLAX™ and represents 3/4 of the global production for flax straw, dew-retted. Source: statistic data for production of retted straw and of long and short fibres. The data was gathered by the Flax-Linen Economic Observatory of the Alliance for Linen-Flax and Hemp, from national organisations for flax cultivation and scutching in France, Belgium and the Netherlands.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data refer to the average scutching process for the geography given.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data on inputs to the field activities are collected directly from the Alliance for European Flax-Linen & Hemp. The ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collection has been performed by the Alliance for European Flax-Linen & Hemp from referent sources incl. Arvalis and Inagro (agronomic institutes referent respectively for France and for Belgium-Netherlands) for average agricultural technical itinerary practiced in these 3 countries; and interbranch production statistics. These data represent the European production which is 100% certified to European Flax (TM) and amounts for 3/4 of the global production for fibre, flax, long, scutched on 2023.

flow.name: fibre, flax, long, scutched

exchanges.description: Calculated from average yield of long scutched fibre in France, Belgium and the Netherlands, weighted each country's production. 1 kg of flax straw, dew-retted = 22% of straw weight.

exchanges.description: This service is included in the dataset to produce iron wire used as packaging for short scutching fibre. An average 5g / kg short scutching fibre is considered. Hence, for this dataset, considering 0,5 of short scutching fibre, 0.0025 is reported (Note that this is a conservative value, from companies who use iron wire. Some scutchers integrate the next processing step without the need for packaging).
